Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Recognized that the hospital patient management process follows a series of distinct stages (arrival, triage, diagnostics, loop for treatment, advanced diagnostics, administrative steps) which can be expressed hierarchically as a process tree.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Understood that the operators provided in the problem statement (->, X, +, *) represent sequencing, exclusive choice, concurrency, and looping, respectively, and must be used to implement the process tree.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified that the process starts with a sequential execution of arrival (A), registration (RG), and intake assessment (IA), which can be modeled as a SEQUENCE operator with a nested -> operator for RG followed by IA.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Assumed that the choice between CE and FBP, based on triage classification (TC), could be modeled using an X operator, ignoring the conditional dependency hinted in the problem description due to lack of conditional operators.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Determined that the loop structure starting after abnormal results must include SC (Specialist Consultation), an exclusive choice between TM (Targeted Medication) and SPT (Specialized Physical Therapy), and RDT (Re-Diagnostic Test), repeating until normal test results are achieved.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Recognized that the advanced diagnostics step can be expressed as true concurrency (+ operator) between Advanced Imaging (AI) and Nutritional Counseling (NC).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Placed the administrative steps (FAS and DDI) in a SEQUENCE operator, as they must happen in order, before the final concurrency block.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Placed the final tasks (Billing, Insurance Processing, and Medical Records Finalization) in a true concurrency block (+ operator) as they can happen simultaneously.

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Struggled to connect the triage steps logically with the rest of the process tree, particularly in ensuring that IA flowed into the triage evaluation without disrupting the structure or violating constraints of the operators.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Validated that the constructed process tree respected the hierarchical structure and operator rules, but noted unresolved ambiguity in modeling the conditional choice based on TC.
